Update relationship types for GO:0006086 pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA

Updated relationship types based on consensus in issue #30126:
- Changed 'has_part' to 'starts_with' for GO:0004739 (pyruvate dehydrogenase activity)
- Changed 'has_part' to 'ends_with' for GO:0004742 (dihydrolipoyllysine-residue acetyltransferase activity)
- Retained 'has_part' for GO:0004148 (dihydrolipoyl dehydrogenase activity)

These changes provide more specific process order information about the pyruvate dehydrogenase complex activities.

Fixes #30126

Add triggering pipelines mini-tutorial (#3495)

* WIP v1

* Update user guide tutorial on triggering pipelines from external systems

- Corrected the formatting of the instructions for setting up GitHub Secrets, ensuring clarity in the steps provided.
- Improved the readability of the follow-up actions section by breaking a long sentence into two and ensuring proper line endings.

This update aims to enhance user understanding and navigation within the tutorial, providing clearer guidance on integrating external systems with ZenML pipelines.

* WIP Add tutorial on Continuous Integration and Deployment for ML Pipelines

- Introduced a comprehensive tutorial detailing the setup of CI/CD workflows for ML pipelines using ZenML and GitHub Actions. This includes steps for creating development and production stacks, setting up authentication, and configuring GitHub Actions for both CI and CD.
- Updated the Table of Contents to include a new entry for "Continuous Integration and Deployment," enhancing navigation for users seeking guidance on CI/CD practices within ZenML.

This addition aims to provide users with a structured approach to automating testing and deployment, ensuring high-quality models are delivered to production while maintaining reproducibility across environments.

* Update headers

* docs: improve tutorial header styles for consistency

This commit updates the headers in the trigger-pipelines-from-external-systems.md
tutorial to follow a more descriptive, action-oriented style consistent with
other tutorials. Headers now focus on what each section accomplishes rather than
using generic step numbers.

Remove incorrect 'part_of conus arteriosus' relationship from uterine tube structures

Removed the incorrect relationship 'part_of UBERON:0003983 \! conus arteriosus' from:
- UBERON:0007181 (serosa of infundibulum of uterine tube)
- UBERON:0007182 (muscle layer of infundibulum of uterine tube)

These uterine tube structures were incorrectly related to the heart structure, which has now been fixed.

Signed-off-by: Chris Mungall <cjm@berkeleybop.org>

Fixed issue #2911: removed erroneous part_of relationships between conus arteriosus and uterine tube structures

The terms UBERON:0007181 (serosa of infundibulum of uterine tube) and UBERON:0007182 (muscle layer of infundibulum of uterine tube) incorrectly had part_of relationships to UBERON:0003983 (conus arteriosus), which is a cardiac structure. This commit removes these incorrect relationships.

Add default parameter to tyro.conf.arg()

This commit adds a new `default=` parameter to tyro.conf.arg(), allowing users to specify default values for fields that don't have their own defaults. When a field already has a default value, the field default takes precedence over the arg default.

Key changes:
- Add `default: Any = MISSING_NONPROP` to _ArgConfig class
- Add default parameter to the arg() function and update its docstring
- Update FieldDefinition.make() to properly handle the default parameter
- Add comprehensive tests for various scenarios (basic usage, None values, immutable types, unions, etc.)
- Update CLAUDE.md with improved style guidance for comment formatting

feat: Implement comprehensive AWS command security system

This commit adds a robust security validation system for AWS CLI commands:

- Created new security.py module with extensive security validation logic
- Replaced naive command validation with a comprehensive three-layer approach:
  1. Dangerous command blocking for security-critical operations
  2. Safe pattern overrides for read-only operations
  3. Regular expression rules for complex security patterns

- Added configurable security modes via AWS_MCP_SECURITY_MODE environment variable
- Created security_config_example.yaml demonstrating custom security rules
- Implemented integration and unit tests for the security system
- Updated documentation in README.md with security best practices
- Improved pipe command handling for multiple commands

Security focus areas include:
- IAM and identity management to prevent account compromise
- Audit and logging integrity protection (CloudTrail)
- Network security (security groups, NACLs)
- Data protection (S3 buckets, KMS)

Fix memory leak in Cache and SQLList classes

This commit addresses memory leaks related to SQLAlchemy resources not being properly released. Key changes:

1. Added close() method to Cache class to properly dispose of SQLAlchemy engines
2. Added __del__ method to Cache for resource cleanup during garbage collection
3. Modified Cache.__exit__ to call close() for proper context manager cleanup
4. Added close() and __del__ methods to SQLiteDict for engine disposal
5. Improved SQLList.__cleanup() to properly dispose engines and remove circular refs
6. Modified profiling script to use context managers for reliable cleanup

The fixes ensure SQLAlchemy resources are properly released between runs,
preventing memory leaks when running multiple jobs in sequence.

create_subprocess_shell to avoid shell injection vulnerabilities. The implementation:

- Splits command arguments with shlex in a more secure way
- Uses subprocess_exec to bypass the shell entirely
- Updates all unit tests to match the new implementation
- Adds clarifying comments about piped commands still using shell

- Implement getAuthInfo and getTeamSlug methods in the API client

Improve schema validation and documentation for Honeycomb queries

Key improvements:
- Add Zod refinements to explicitly validate COUNT operations have no column
- Make the schema descriptions clearer with explicit examples
- Add warning emoji (âš ï¸) to highlight critical rules
- Update JSON schema to match official Honeycomb specification
- Make calculations optional in schema with default COUNT
- Make op and order optional in OrderSchema as per spec
- Rename having to havings for spec compliance

These changes aim to prevent LLMs from generating invalid queries,

feat: set icons for each type of notification (#17115) Each notification type will have an icon to represent the context: This depends on https://github.com/coder/coder/pull/17013

feat: add app status tracking to the backend (#17163)

This does ~95% of the backend work required to integrate the AI work.

Most left to integrate from the tasks branch is just frontend, which
will be a lot smaller I believe.

The real difference between this branch and that one is the abstraction
-- this now attaches statuses to apps, and returns the latest status
reported as part of a workspace.

This change enables us to have a similar UX to in the tasks branch, but
for agents other than Claude Code as well. Any app can report status
now.

feat(cli): add `coder exp mcp` command  (#17066)

Adds a `coder exp mcp` command which will start a local MCP server
listening on stdio with the following capabilities:
* Show logged in user (`coder whoami`)
* List workspaces (`coder list`)
* List templates (`coder templates list`)
* Start a workspace (`coder start`)
* Stop a workspace (`coder stop`)
* Fetch a single workspace (no direct CLI analogue)
* Execute a command inside a workspace (`coder exp rpty`)
* Report the status of a task (currently a no-op, pending task support)

This can be tested as follows:

```
# Start a local Coder server.
./scripts/develop.sh
# Start a workspace. Currently, creating workspaces is not supported.
./scripts/coder-dev.sh create -t docker --yes
# Add the MCP to your Claude config.
claude mcp add coder ./scripts/coder-dev.sh exp mcp
# Tell Claude to do something Coder-related. You may need to nudge it to use the tools.
claude 'start a docker workspace and tell me what version of python is installed'
```

fix: remove shared mutable state between oidc tests (#17179)

Spotted on main: https://github.com/coder/coder/actions/runs/14179449567/job/39721999486
```
=== FAIL: coderd TestOIDCDomainErrorMessage/MalformedEmailErrorOmitsDomains (0.01s)
==================
WARNING: DATA RACE
Read at 0x00c060b54e68 by goroutine 296485:
  golang.org/x/oauth2.(*Config).Exchange()
      /home/runner/go/pkg/mod/golang.org/x/oauth2@v0.28.0/oauth2.go:228 +0x1d8
  github.com/coder/coder/v2/coderd.(*OIDCConfig).Exchange()
      <autogenerated>:1 +0xb7
  github.com/coder/coder/v2/coderd.New.func11.12.1.2.ExtractOAuth2.1.1()
      /home/runner/work/coder/coder/coderd/httpmw/oauth2.go:168 +0x7b5
  net/http.HandlerFunc.ServeHTTP()
      /opt/hostedtoolcache/go/1.24.1/x64/src/net/http/server.go:2294 +0x47
[...]
Previous write at 0x00c060b54e68 by goroutine 55730:
  github.com/coder/coder/v2/coderd/coderdtest/oidctest.(*FakeIDP).SetRedirect()
      /home/runner/work/coder/coder/coderd/coderdtest/oidctest/idp.go:1280 +0x1e6
  github.com/coder/coder/v2/coderd/coderdtest/oidctest.(*FakeIDP).LoginWithClient()
      /home/runner/work/coder/coder/coderd/coderdtest/oidctest/idp.go:494 +0x170
  github.com/coder/coder/v2/coderd/coderdtest/oidctest.(*FakeIDP).AttemptLogin()
      /home/runner/work/coder/coder/coderd/coderdtest/oidctest/idp.go:479 +0x624
  github.com/coder/coder/v2/coderd_test.TestOIDCDomainErrorMessage.func3()
      /home/runner/work/coder/coder/coderd/userauth_test.go:2041 +0x1f2
```

As seen, this race was caused by sharing a `*oidctest.FakeIDP` between test cases. The fix is to simply do the setup twice.

```
$ go test -race -run "TestOIDCDomainErrorMessage" github.com/coder/coder/v2/coderd -count=100
ok      github.com/coder/coder/v2/coderd        7.551s
````

fix(site): standardize headers for Admin Settings page (#16911)

## Changes made
- Switched almost all headers to use the `SettingHeader` component
- Redesigned component to be more composition-based, to stay in line
with the patterns we're starting to use more throughout the codebase
- Refactored `SettingHeader` to be based on Radix and Tailwind, rather
than Emotion/MUI
- Added additional props to `SettingHeader` to help resolve issues with
the component creating invalid HTML
- Beefed up `SettingHeader` to have better out-of-the-box accessibility
- Addressed some typographic problems in `SettingHeader`
- Addressed some responsive layout problems for `SettingsHeader`
- Added first-ever stories for `SettingsHeader`

## Notes
- There are still a few headers that aren't using `SettingHeader` yet.
There were some UI edge cases that meant I couldn't reliably bring it in
without consulting the Design team first. I'm a little less worried
about them, because they at least *look* like the other headers, but
it'd be nice if we could centralize everything in a followup PR

docs: update SMTP configuration in notifications docs (#17161)

## Issue

Closes #16206

(thanks @bjornrobertsson - not sure why I can't tag you as a reviewer)

Mismatch between the SMTP configuration UI and the documentation.

## Verification

Claude verified this issue by examining:

1. The current SMTP configuration code in the codebase
2. The CLI help documentation for the server command
3. The examples provided in the notifications documentation

The issue was confirmed by finding:
- A reference to a deprecated variable
`CODER_NOTIFICATIONS_EMAIL_FORCE_TLS` instead of the current
`CODER_EMAIL_FORCE_TLS`
- Missing information about the port format required for the SMTP
smarthost

## Changes made

1. Updated the `--email-smarthost` description to clarify that the
format should include both hostname and port: `(format:
     hostname:port)`
2. Fixed the reference to the TLS environment variable in the STARTTLS
description, replacing the deprecated
`CODER_NOTIFICATIONS_EMAIL_FORCE_TLS` with the correct
`CODER_EMAIL_FORCE_TLS`

## Additional information

The Gmail and Outlook examples in the documentation already correctly
show the port included in the smarthost configuration, but the main
description table needed to be updated to explicitly mention this
requirement.


[preview](https://coder.com/docs/@16206-smtp-required-components/admin/monitoring/notifications)

SAK-46662 Fix constraint violation during site copy of assignments

Fix a constraint violation error that occurs during site copy operations when copying assignments
with AllPurposeItem supplements. The error occurred because the AssignmentAllPurposeItem was being
saved to the database before its required assignmentId field was set.

This fix removes the premature save operation and ensures the entity is only saved after all required
fields are properly initialized.

commit_message: Merge branch 'main' into feat/add-server-yelp-fusionai

Add vibe cording guide documents

- Add docs for vibe corders explaining Giselle project usage with AI assistants
- Create Node.js installation guide with NVM and pnpm setup
- Update introduction with current vibe coding concepts
- Document playground setup with environment variables
- Add vibe cording documentation section to README

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
prototype data-mod
Update Node.js TypeScript configuration for library use
Add data-mod package
Fix setValueAtPath arguments in typo fix function
Refactor fixTypoAccesorToAccessor with clearer variable names
Rename parseAndRepairWorkspace to parseAndMod for clarity
Add parseAndMod utility to fix invalid generations
Add reference to PR #570 for accesor to accessor fix
Convert indentation from spaces to tabs in node.json
Convert Results module docstrings to Google style and add doctests
Improved handling of QuestionMatrix
Fix trailing space issue
Trailing whitespace improvements

Enhance multiple choice answer validation with tests

Improves the MultipleChoiceResponseValidator to properly handle:
- Answers with trailing whitespace
- Partial matching of answer options
- Answers with missing punctuation
- None value handling
- Ambiguous option resolution

Added comprehensive test suite covering various edge cases to ensure
robust validation behavior and prevent regression.

fix: Add #nosec G115 annotations to address integer overflow conversion warnings

This change adds appropriate '#nosec G115' annotations to various integer type conversions
that are safe in their specific context. These warnings would be flagged by Go 1.24.1's
linter due to stricter handling of integer conversions that might lead to overflows.

Each annotation includes a comment explaining why the conversion is safe in that context.

fix: Add more #nosec G115 annotations for integer overflow warnings

This change continues adding appropriate '#nosec G115' annotations to various integer
type conversions that are safe in their specific contexts. Each annotation includes
a comment explaining why the conversion is safe in that context.

Additional areas fixed:
- tailnet module (node and peer IDs)
- VPN module (prefix lengths and router configs)
- Agent SSH module (terminal dimensions and X11 protocol)
- Notifications module (configuration parameters)
- Various other integer conversions where the range is guaranteed to be safe

fix: address G115 integer overflow linter warnings for Go 1.24.1

Added #nosec G115 annotations with explanatory comments for all integer
type conversions flagged by the gosec linter. These annotations explain
why each conversion is safe within its context.

Common patterns:
- Network statistics expected to be within int64 range
- Port numbers within uint16 range (0-65535)
- String lengths expected to be within uint16 range
- DERP/STUN port numbers and region IDs within int32 range
- Slice lengths expected to be within int32 range
- Display order values expected to be within int32 range
- SSH exit status values expected to be within int32 range (0-255)
- Pagination parameters expected to be within int32 range

fix: address more G115 integer overflow linter warnings

Added #nosec G115 annotations with explanatory comments for additional
integer type conversions flagged by the gosec linter. These include:
- HTTP status codes expected to be within int32 range (100-599)
- Request counts and allowances expected to be within int32 range
- Build numbers expected to be within int32 range
- Output lengths expected to be within int32 range

refactor: replace if-else chains with switch statements

Changed if-else chains to switch statements in several files to address
gocritic:ifElseChain linter warnings. This makes the code more idiomatic
and easier to maintain.

Files updated:
- coderd/audit/request.go
- coderd/healthcheck/derphealth/derp.go
- vpn/router.go

fix: resolve unused parameter linter issues for Go 1.24.1 compatibility

Fixed unused parameter issues by replacing them with underscores or named return values. This makes the codebase compatible with Go 1.24.1's stricter linting rules.

commit_message:
fix: Add fallback from float16 to float32 for GPUs without efficient float16 support

- Add try/catch to transcribe.py to gracefully fall back to float32 when float16 fails
- Add WHISPER_COMPUTE_TYPE environment variable support in transcription.ts
- Improve logging for compute type selection

fix: Improve CUDA memory management for diarization

- Add memory cleanup before and after diarization to prevent OOM errors
- Set PYTORCH_CUDA_ALLOC_CONF=expandable_segments:True for better memory management
- Properly unload models when switching from transcription to diarization
- Add explicit garbage collection to free memory between operations

fix: UI enhancements

- Implement side-by-side layout for better usability
- Improve navigation with descriptive labels
- Convert upload panel to floating modal
- Optimize for large screens with better width constraints
- Fix scrolling issues for long transcriptions
- Replace summarization button icon with star for better clarity
- Add warning about HF_API_KEY environment variable requirement in setup page

commit_message:
fix: Improve CUDA memory management for diarization

- Add memory cleanup before and after diarization to prevent OOM errors
- Set PYTORCH_CUDA_ALLOC_CONF=expandable_segments:True for better memory management
- Properly unload models when switching from transcription to diarization
- Add explicit garbage collection to free memory between operations

Fix bug where clicking suggestion reuses old input text

The fix addresses issue #790 where clicking suggestions didn't correctly use the
selected suggestion text. The issue was due to React's asynchronous state updates,
where the suggestion text was being set in state but the operation was performed
before React had processed the update.

This implementation directly passes the suggestion text to performOperation,
bypassing the need to wait for state updates, while respecting the user's
variants setting.

Expose vecdot, vecmat and matvec helpers

Add three new functions that expose the underlying Blockwise operations:
- vecdot: Computes dot products between vectors with broadcasting
- matvec: Computes matrix-vector products with broadcasting
- vecmat: Computes vector-matrix products with broadcasting

These match the NumPy API for similar operations and complement the
existing matmul function. Each comes with appropriate error handling,
parameter validation, and comprehensive test coverage.

Fixes #1237

Simplify matrix/vector helper functions

- Remove redundant dimension checks that Blockwise already handles
- Streamline test cases while keeping essential coverage
- Based on PR feedback from Ricardo

Added enrichment guide page to OAK documentation

This commit adds a comprehensive guide on Enrichment/Over-Representation Analysis
to the OAK documentation. The guide covers:
- Statistical methods and concepts for enrichment analysis
- How predicates affect enrichment calculation during roll-up
- Using the command line for enrichment analysis
- Using the Python API for programmatic enrichment analysis
- Redundancy filtering and results interpretation

The guide is linked to the main guide index and includes references to
related guide sections on associations and ontology graphs.

fix: properly apply null values in applyChangeset

When changing a property from a non-null value to null, the applyChangeset
function did not correctly apply the change. The issue was in the conditional
check that determines if a change should be applied as a leaf change or a
branch change. Modified the condition to explicitly handle null values with
ADD operations as leaf changes.

Fixes #198

refactor(passkey): redesign WebAuthn API for improved type safety

This commit introduces a completely redesigned WebAuthn API for the passkey authentication
plugin, focusing on type safety and improved developer experience:

- Add a `PasskeyAuthPlugin` trait to define standardized authentication methods
- Replace string and JSON value parameters with strongly-typed structures:
  - `PasskeyRegistrationRequest` and `PasskeyRegistrationCompletion`
  - `PasskeyLoginRequest` and `PasskeyLoginCompletion`
  - `ChallengeId` type for better type safety
- Create separate public-facing credential types:
  - `PasskeyCredentialCreationOptions`
  - `PasskeyCredentialRequestOptions`
- Enhance error handling with detailed context using `PasskeyErrorContext`
- Remove deprecated methods and structures
- Update the `torii` integration to use the new API
- Provide both structured types and convenience methods
- Fix WebAuthn example to work with the new API

BREAKING CHANGE: This removes the deprecated `PasskeyChallenge` structure and
the old method signatures, requiring clients to update to the new API.

feat(dylo-cli)!: implement add/remove dependency commands

This adds two new commands to dylo CLI:
- `dylo add` - Adds dependencies to a module
- `dylo rm` - Removes dependencies from a module
- `dylo gen` - Generates bindings (renamed from the default command)

Both add/remove commands support standard and impl-only dependencies,
integrating with the impl feature system.

BREAKING CHANGE: Command line interface has been restructured from a
parameter-based system to a subcommand-based system. The default command
no longer exists and is now called "gen". Users will need to update their
scripts and workflows to use "dylo gen", "dylo add", or "dylo rm".

Update Infra.tsx to support enhanced worker identification

This commit enhances the infrastructure management UI to leverage the improved worker identification in the backend:

1. Updated the Worker interface to include new fields:
   - displayName: formatted worker name (container@hostname)
   - containerName: container part of the worker name
   - nodeName: node/hostname part of the worker name

2. Enhanced the UI to display and utilize the new fields:
   - Added dedicated columns for Node and Container in the workers table
   - Added Worker Info section in the expanded view showing container and node details
   - Updated worker display to use displayName when available

3. Added new sorting and filtering capabilities:
   - Sort workers by node or container
   - Search by node name or container name

4. Fixed field naming to consistently use camelCase throughout the component

These changes align with backend improvements that enhance worker identification by using
a standardized naming format (CONTAINER@HOSTNAME) to improve observability and management.

fix: move map layers config from preferences to dedicated config

Problem:
Currently map layer visibility settings are stored in user preferences, making
it impossible for new layers to be visible to existing users, as the app copies
the defaults into user preferences which are then never updated.

Solution:
- Move layer visibility configurations from defaultPreferences.config.ts to
  a dedicated sectionLayers export in layers.config.ts
- Update TransitionMainMap to use this configuration first, with fallback to
  user preferences for backward compatibility
- Remove layer configuration from default preferences
- Add unit tests to validate the changes

This change ensures new layers will be visible to all users while maintaining
backward compatibility.

closes #1265

MM-63378: Ensure consistency between Team.Type and Team.AllowOpenInvite

#### Summary
This commit ensures that Team.Type and Team.AllowOpenInvite fields are always kept in sync throughout the codebase, prioritizing privacy by enforcing consistent rules:

1. If Type is private ('I'), AllowOpenInvite must be false
2. If AllowOpenInvite is false, Type must be private ('I')
3. Type is only open ('O') when AllowOpenInvite is true

#### Ticket Link
https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-63378

#### Database Changes
Added database migrations to fix inconsistencies in existing teams.

#### Release Note

Fix assertion error in UniPC scheduler for high step counts

This fixes an edge case in the FlowUniPCMultistepScheduler where using high sampling step counts (> 50) would cause an assertion error in the last step. The issue was that with lower_order_final=True, the order calculation could become 0 when step_index equals len(timesteps), causing 'assert self.this_order > 0' to fail.

The fix ensures this_order is always at least 1, maintaining stability while allowing higher quality generation with increased step counts.

feat: refactor SSH prefix into a workspace suffix

This change modifies the SSH hostname pattern to use a suffix-based approach instead of a prefix.
It adds a new --ssh-hostname-suffix flag to replace the old --ssh-hostname-prefix, supporting
domain-based hostnames like 'workspace.coder' instead of 'coder.workspace'.

The changes:
- Add HostnameSuffix field to SSHConfig and SSHConfigResponse structs
- Deprecate the existing hostname prefix option
- Implement suffix-based hostname parsing in SSH command
- Update VPN DNS to use the hostname suffix
- Use the suffix in tailnet/vpn for DNS configuration

This refactoring is necessary to support one-click buttons for native applications in
Coder Desktop, which requires a suffix-based approach for deep linking and native application
launches.

Fixes #16828
fix: remove deprecated field usage and update SSHConfigResponse in TestHelpers

fix: add Agent Freedom Setting documentation and templates

This commit addresses the agent freedom setting mismatch issue (#16851) by:
1. Adding an Agent Freedom Setting link to the GitHub issue template configuration
2. Creating a comprehensive documentation file (agent-freedom-settings.md)
3. Adding a PR template with correct Agent Freedom Setting format

The documentation explains the various freedom levels, preset values, and how
to correctly specify agent freedom settings to avoid mismatches between preset
names and numeric values.

Update release workflow to create incremental patch versions

This change enables the release workflow to automatically create a new release
on every merge to main by incrementing the patch version number for a given
date-based release. Previously, the workflow always used ".0" as the patch
version, which meant only one release per day was possible.

With this change:
- When a new date is used, it starts with patch version ".0"
- For each subsequent merge on the same day, the patch version is incremented
- The workflow searches for existing tags with the same YYYYMMDD date part
- Finds the highest current patch version and increments it by 1
- The manual patch version input parameter has been removed
- Both automatic and manual triggers now use the same auto-incrementing logic

This ensures we can have multiple releases per day, which enables continuous
delivery for workerd where each merge to main results in a new release with
an automatically incremented version number.

feat: Add secrets store for secure credential management

This commit implements issue #1162, adding a secure secrets store to Julep with the following features:

- Database migration to create 'secrets' table with proper encryption
- TypeSpec models and endpoints for secrets API
- Python query implementations for CRUD operations
- FastAPI routers for developer and agent-scoped secrets
- Template support for using secrets in API calls
- Integration with API call execution to resolve secrets at setup time
- Test fixtures and integration tests
- Documentation for the new secrets feature

Secrets are scoped to either developers or agents and encrypted at rest. They can be
referenced in templates using the secrets object but are only available at 'setup time',
not during task execution steps, to prevent secrets from being exposed in logs.

Implement batch compression for optimized collection materialization

This implements a much more efficient approach to materializing collections by:
1. Grouping elements by type and serializing them in batches
2. Using compression (gzip + pickle) to reduce storage requirements
3. Implementing chunking for handling very large collections
4. Adding efficient chunk-based loading with caching

The v3 format significantly reduces I/O operations to artifact stores,
dramatically improving performance especially for cloud storage backends.

formatting

Fix batch compression for cloud storage backends

This fixes an issue where the batch compression implementation was using Python's
built-in gzip.open() directly with cloud storage URIs (like S3), which fails
because the built-in functions only support local file paths.

The solution:
1. Use ZenML's fileio utilities which support various backends
2. Implement in-memory compression/decompression using BytesIO buffers
3. Properly handle reading and writing to cloud storage

The changes ensure our optimized collection materialization works properly with
all storage backends, including S3, GCS, and Azure Blob Storage.

Add ProcessGraphStrategy for task-based automation

This new strategy:
1. Uses OmniParser for parsing visual state and Gemini 2.0 for evaluation
2. Takes natural language task descriptions instead of recording IDs
3. Processes coalesced actions from events.py
4. Builds and maintains a process graph where states are nodes and actions are edges

The graph is constructed before replay based on recording + task description,
and is updated during replay based on observed states. Uses Pydantic for
structured data handling and robust JSON parsing.

refactor(twap): implement strategy pattern for accumulator updates

This commit refactors the TWAP module to use the strategy pattern more
thoroughly for its accumulator updates. Previously, the strategy pattern
was only used for TWAP computation but not for the accumulator updates.

Key changes:
- Add `updateAccumulators` method to the twapStrategy interface
- Implement strategy-specific accumulator update logic for both arithmetic and geometric strategies
- Modify `getInterpolatedRecord` to use the provided strategy's accumulator update method
- Update remaining code to use the appropriate strategy for accumulator updates
- Maintain backward compatibility in exported functions and existing code paths

With this change, geometric accumulator calculations are now only performed
when using the geometric strategy, making the system more efficient by avoiding
unnecessary calculations for the arithmetic strategy.

Expose vecdot, vecmat and matvec helpers

Add three new functions that expose the underlying Blockwise operations:
- vecdot: Computes dot products between vectors with broadcasting
- matvec: Computes matrix-vector products with broadcasting
- vecmat: Computes vector-matrix products with broadcasting

These match the NumPy API for similar operations and complement the
existing matmul function. Each comes with appropriate error handling,
parameter validation, and comprehensive test coverage.

Fix memory leak in Cache and SQLList classes

This commit addresses memory leaks related to SQLAlchemy resources not being properly released. Key changes:

1. Added close() method to Cache class to properly dispose of SQLAlchemy engines
2. Added __del__ method to Cache for resource cleanup during garbage collection
3. Modified Cache.__exit__ to call close() for proper context manager cleanup
4. Added close() and __del__ methods to SQLiteDict for engine disposal
5. Improved SQLList.__cleanup() to properly dispose engines and remove circular refs
6. Modified profiling script to use context managers for reliable cleanup

The fixes ensure SQLAlchemy resources are properly released between runs,
preventing memory leaks when running multiple jobs in sequence.

Add support for capturing Jinja2 variables set with {% set %}

This change adds functionality to capture variables set in Jinja2 templates with
{% set variable = value %} syntax and make them available in the Result object.

Key changes:
- Add captured_variables field to EDSLResultObjectInput
- Add get_captured_variables() method to InvigilatorBase
- Update invigilators to include captured variables in results
- Modify Result.from_interview() to process captured variables
- Update tests to handle changed result structure

To use this feature, in a template:
{% set my_variable = 'Hello World' %}{{ vars.set('my_variable', my_variable) }}

Then access the captured variables in the result:
captured_vars = result.raw_model_response["question_name_captured_variables"]

   - Common causes of the error
   - Steps to fix the error
   - Example code that would trigger the exception

4. Adding proper type hints and improving constructor parameters where appropriate

5. Ensuring consistent formatting across all exception classes

These changes greatly improve the developer experience when encountering errors,
providing clear guidance on what went wrong and how to fix it.

commit_message:
feat: add Cortex promo popup

- Added new floating CortexPromoPopup component
- Integrated popup with Synapse styling
- Added user analytics tracking
- Positioned in bottom-right corner with dismiss functionality
- Persists dismiss state with localStorage

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

fix(abigen): implement solc binary fallback for Apple Silicon Macs

- Add fallback mechanism that downloads native solc binaries when Docker fails
- Detect Apple Silicon platform and use appropriate binary
- Cache downloaded binaries to prevent repeated downloads
- Implement race-safe file locking for concurrent processes
- Add tests for binary downloads and direct compilation
- Update documentation with new fallback mechanism information

Fixes #3366

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

fix(abigen): correct URL for solc binary on Apple Silicon

The URL for downloading solc binaries for Apple Silicon was incorrect.
Fix the URL to use 'solc-macos' instead of 'solc-macos-aarch64'.

- agents/contracts
- services/rfq/contracts

Fixed the URL format for solc binary download on Apple Silicon

fix(abigen): normalize contract names and metadata paths in fallback mode

When using the solc binary fallback mechanism, we now normalize the contract names
and metadata paths to match the Docker-based format, which has 'solidity/' prefix.
This helps minimize diffs when switching between Docker and direct binary modes.

feat: add Windsurf IDE module

Adds a Terraform module for the Windsurf IDE similar to the Cursor IDE module.
This module provides integration with Coder workspaces for Windsurf IDE.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

fix: wipe PostgreSQL data to ensure unique deployment IDs

The GCP Marketplace VM images were all showing the same deployment ID
(68aaf8cf-de7f-452f-8f23-32a9ba7fa864) because Coder was started during
the image build process, which generated and saved a deployment ID in
the PostgreSQL database.

This change:
1. Stops the Coder service in the cleanup script
2. Wipes the PostgreSQL data directory
3. Reinitializes the database structure
4. Ensures PostgreSQL is stopped before image creation

Fixes #180

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

Add flexible workflow architecture for LLM experiments

- Implements the four workflows from Anthropic's "Building Effective Agents" research:
  - Prompt chaining: Sequential execution of prompts with outputs feeding into inputs
  - Routing: Decision-making between different workflow paths
  - Parallelization: Running multiple LLM calls concurrently
  - Evaluator-optimizer: Iterative improvement of outputs through evaluation and optimization

- Creates core models (Workflow, WorkflowStep, StepTransition, WorkflowTrial, WorkflowStepExecution)
- Implements workflow runners for each workflow type
- Adds supporting services for condition evaluation, output evaluation, and content optimization
- Includes tests and factories for all components
